ns0:Resource.xsi:schemaLocation: http://www.ivoa.net/xml/RegistryInterface/v1.0 http://software.astrogrid.org/schema/registry/RegistryInterface/v1.0/RegistryInterface.xsd http://www.ivoa.net/xml/VOResource/v1.0 http://software.astrogrid.org/schema/vo-resource-types/VOResource/v1.0/VOResource.xsd http://www.ivoa.net/xml/VODataService/v1.0 http://software.astrogrid.org/schema/vo-resource-types/VODataService/v1.0/VODataService.xsd http://www.ivoa.net/xml/VOTable/v1.0 http://software.astrogrid.org/schema/vo-formats/VOTable/v1.0/VOTable.xsd http://www.ivoa.net/xml/ConeSearch/v1.0 http://software.astrogrid.org/schema/vo-resource-types/ConeSearch/v1.0/ConeSearch.xsd http://www.ivoa.net/xml/SIA/v1.0 http://software.astrogrid.org/schema/vo-resource-types/SIA/v1.0/SIA.xsd http://www.ivoa.net/xml/SSA/v0.4 http://software.astrogrid.org/schema/vo-resource-types/SSA/v0.4/SSA.xsd urn:astrogrid:schema:vo-resource-types:STAP:v1.0 http://software.astrogrid.org/schema/vo-resource-types/STAP/v1.0/STAP.xsd http://www.ivoa.net/xml/CEA/v1.0rc1 http://software.astrogrid.org/schema/vo-resource-types/CEAService/v1.0rc1/CEAService.xsd
ns0:Resource.title: XMM-Newton Serendipitous Source Catalogue (2XMM)

curation.publisher: WFAU, Institute for Astronomy, University of Edinburgh

content.subject: x-ray xray XMM
content.description: XMM is the second comprehensive catalogue of serendipitous X-ray sources from the European Space Agency's (ESA) XMM-Newton observatory. The 2XMM catalogue is the largest X-ray source catalogue ever produced, containing almost twice as many discrete sources as either the ROSAT survey or pointed catalogues. 2XMM complements deeper Chandra and XMM-Newton small area surveys, probing a much larger sky area.

capability.description: twoxmm table: cone search of serendipitous X-ray sources from XMM-Newton Observatory
Access to two applications: general ADQL query, and asynchronous cone-search where relevant/enabled.

table.name: twoxmm
table.description: Contains the parameters provided for each source in the 2XMM catalogu

column.name: DETID
column.description: A consecutive number which identifies each entry (detection) in the catalogue.

column.name: SRCID
column.description: A unique number assigned to a group of catalogue entries which are assumed to be the same source. To identify members of the same group the distance in arcseconds between each pair of sources was compared on the two-sigma level of both positional errors. A maximum distance of 7" was assumed, which was reduced to 0.9 * DIST_NN (distance to the nearest neighbour) where necessary.

column.name: IAUNAME
column.description: The IAU name assigned to the unique SRCID.

column.name: SRC_NUM
column.description: The (decimal) source number in the individual source list for this observation; in the hexadecimal system it identifies the source-specific product files belonging to this detection.

column.name: MATCH_1XMM
column.description: The IAU name of the 1XMM source ID matched within radius of 3 arcsec and using the closest candidate.

column.name: SEP_1XMM
column.description: The distance between this source and the matched 1XMM source (MATCH_1XMM) in arcseconds.

column.name: SRCID_2XMMP
column.description: The source ID of the 2XMMp unique source matched within radius of 3" and using the closest candidate.

column.name: MATCH_2XMMP
column.description: The IAU name of the 2XMMp source ID matched within radius of 3" and using the closest candidate.

column.name: SEP_2XMMP
column.description: The distance between this source and the matched 2XMMp source (MATCH_2XMMp) in arcseconds.

column.name: MJD_START
column.description: Modified Julian Date (i.e., JD - 2400000.5) of the start of the observation.

column.name: MJD_STOP
column.description: Modified Julian Date (i.e., JD - 2400000.5) of the end of the observation.

column.name: OBS_CLASS
column.description: Quality classification of the whole observation based on the area flagged as bad in the manual flagging process as compared to the whole detection area. 0 means nothing has been flagged; 1 indicates that 0% < area < 0.1% of the total detection mask has been flagged; 2 indicates that 0.1% <= area < 1% has been flagged; 3 indicates that 1% <= area < 10% has been flagged; 4 indicates that 10% <= area < 100% has been flagged; and 5 means that the whole field was flagged as bad.

column.name: PN_FILTER
column.description: PN filter. The options are Thick, Medium, Thin1, Thin2, and Open, depending on the efficiency of the optical blocking.

column.name: M1_FILTER
column.description: M1 filter. The options are Thick, Medium, Thin1, and Open, depending on the efficiency of the optical blocking.

column.name: M2_FILTER
column.description: M2 filter. The options are Thick, Medium, Thin1, and Open, depending on the efficiency of the optical blocking.

column.name: PN_SUBMODE
column.description: PN observing mode. The options are full frame mode with the full FOV exposed (in two sub-modes), and large window mode with only parts of the FOV exposed.

column.name: M1_SUBMODE
column.description: M1 observing mode. The options are full frame mode with the full FOV exposed, partial window mode with only parts of the central CCD exposed (in different sub-modes), and timing mode where the central CCD was not exposed ('Fast Uncompressed').

column.name: M2_SUBMODE
column.description: M2 observing mode. The options are full frame mode with the full FOV exposed, partial window mode with only parts of the central CCD exposed (in different sub-modes), and timing mode where the central CCD was not exposed ('Fast Uncompressed').

column.name: RA
column.description: Corrected Right Ascension of the detection in degrees (J2000) after statistical correlation of the emldetect coordinates, RA_UNC and DEC_UNC, with the USNO B1.0 optical source catalogue using the SAS task eposcorr. In case where the cross-correlation is determined to be unreliable no correction is applied and this value is therefore the same as RA_UNC.

column.name: DEC
column.description: Corrected Declination of the detection in degrees (J2000) after statistical correlation of the emldetect coordinates, RA_UNC and DEC_UNC, with the USNO B1.0 optical source catalogue using the SAS task eposcorr. In case where the cross-correlation is determined to be unreliable no correction is applied and this value is therefore the same as DEC_UNC.

column.name: POSERR
column.description: Total position uncertainty in arcseconds calculated by combining the statistical error RADEC_ERR and the systematic error SYSERR as follows: POSERR = SQRT ( RADEC_ERR&sup2; + SYSERR&sup2; ).

column.name: LII
column.description: Galactic longitude of the detection in degrees corresponding to the (corrected) coordinates RA and DEC.

column.name: BII
column.description: Galactic latitude of the detection in degrees corresponding to the (corrected) coordinates RA and DEC.

column.name: RADEC_ERR
column.description: Statistical 1 &sigma; error on the detection position in arcseconds.

column.name: SYSERR
column.description: The systematic 1 &sigma; error on the detection position in arcseconds. It is set to be 0.35 arcsec if the SAS task eposcorr results in a statistically reliable cross-correlation with USNO B1.0 optical catalogue. Otherwise the error is 1.0 arsec.

column.name: RA_UNC
column.description: Right Ascension of the source in degrees (J2000) as determined by the SAS task emldetect by fitting a detection simultaneously in all cameras and energy bands.

column.name: DEC_UNC
column.description: Declination of the source in degrees (J2000) as determined by the SAS task emldetect by fitting a detection simultaneously in all cameras and energy bands.

column.name: HTMID
column.description: Hierarchical Triangular Mesh (HTM) index, 20 deep, for equatorial co-ordinates

column.name: EP_EXTENT
column.description: The Extent radius of a source detected as extended.

column.name: EP_EXTENT_ERR
column.description: The Extent error of a source detected as extended.

column.name: EP_EXTENT_ML
column.description: The extent likelihood is the likelihood of the detection being extended as given by P = - ln (EXTENT_ML) , where P is the probability the extent occurring by chance.

column.name: EP_HR1
column.description: The EP hardness ratio between the bands 1 & 2

column.name: EP_HR1_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the EP hardness ratio between the bands 1 & 2

column.name: EP_HR2
column.description: The EP hardness ratio between the bands 2 & 3

column.name: EP_HR2_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the EP hardness ratio between the bands 2 & 3

column.name: EP_HR3
column.description: The EP hardness ratio between the bands 3 & 4

column.name: EP_HR3_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the EP hardness ratio between the bands 3 & 4

column.name: EP_HR4
column.description: The EP hardness ratio between the bands 4 & 5

column.name: EP_HR4_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the EP hardness ratio between the bands 4 & 5

column.name: PN_HR1
column.description: The PN hardness ratio between the bands 1 & 2

column.name: PN_HR1_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the PN hardness ratio between the bands 1 & 2

column.name: PN_HR2
column.description: The PN hardness ratio between the bands 2 & 3

column.name: PN_HR2_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the PN hardness ratio between the bands 2 & 3

column.name: PN_HR3
column.description: The PN hardness ratio between the bands 3 & 4

column.name: PN_HR3_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the PN hardness ratio between the bands 3 & 4

column.name: PN_HR4
column.description: The PN hardness ratio between the bands 4 & 5

column.name: PN_HR4_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the PN hardness ratio between the bands 4 & 5

column.name: M1_HR1
column.description: The M1 hardness ratio between the bands 1 & 2

column.name: M1_HR1_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the M1 hardness ratio between the bands 1 & 2

column.name: M1_HR2
column.description: The M1 hardness ratio between the bands 2 & 3

column.name: M1_HR2_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the M1 hardness ratio between the bands 2 & 3

column.name: M1_HR3
column.description: The M1 hardness ratio between the bands 3 & 4

column.name: M1_HR3_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the M1 hardness ratio between the bands 3 & 4

column.name: M1_HR4
column.description: The M1 hardness ratio between the bands 4 & 5

column.name: M1_HR4_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the M1 hardness ratio between the bands 4 & 5

column.name: M2_HR1
column.description: The M2 hardness ratio between the bands 1 & 2

column.name: M2_HR1_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the M2 hardness ratio between the bands 1 & 2

column.name: M2_HR2
column.description: The M2 hardness ratio between the bands 2 & 3

column.name: M2_HR2_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the M2 hardness ratio between the bands 2 & 3

column.name: M2_HR3
column.description: The M2 hardness ratio between the bands 3 & 4

column.name: M2_HR3_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the M2 hardness ratio between the bands 3 & 4

column.name: M2_HR4
column.description: The M2 hardness ratio between the bands 4 & 5

column.name: M2_HR4_ERR
column.description: The 1 &sigma; error of the M2 hardness ratio between the bands 4 & 5

column.name: PN_1_EXP
column.description: The PN band 1 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: PN_2_EXP
column.description: The PN band 2 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: PN_3_EXP
column.description: The PN band 3 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: PN_4_EXP
column.description: The PN band 4 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: PN_5_EXP
column.description: The PN band 5 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M1_1_EXP
column.description: The M1 band 1 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M1_2_EXP
column.description: The M1 band 1 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M1_3_EXP
column.description: The M1 band 2 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M1_4_EXP
column.description: The M1 band 3 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M1_5_EXP
column.description: The M1 band 4 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M2_1_EXP
column.description: The M2 band 5 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M2_2_EXP
column.description: The M2 band 2 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M2_3_EXP
column.description: The M2 band 3 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M2_4_EXP
column.description: The M2 band 4 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: M2_5_EXP
column.description: The M2 band 5 exposure map, combining the mirror vignetting, detector efficiency, bad pixels and CCD gaps.

column.name: PN_ONTIME
column.description: The PN ontime value (the total good exposure time (after GTI filtering) of the CCD where the detection is positioned).

column.name: M1_ONTIME
column.description: The M1 ontime value (the total good exposure time (after GTI filtering) of the CCD where the detection is positioned).

column.name: M2_ONTIME
column.description: The M2 ontime value (the total good exposure time (after GTI filtering) of the CCD where the detection is positioned).

column.name: PN_OFFAX
column.description: The PN offaxis angle (the distance between the detection position and the onaxis position on the respective detector).

column.name: M1_OFFAX
column.description: The M1 offaxis angle (the distance between the detection position and the onaxis position on the respective detector).

column.name: M2_OFFAX
column.description: The M2 offaxis angle, (the distance between the detection position and the onaxis position on the respective detector).

column.name: PN_MASKFRAC
column.description: The PSF weighted mean of the detector coverage of a detection as derived from the detection mask.

column.name: M1_MASKFRAC
column.description: The PSF weighted mean of the detector coverage of a detection as derived from the detection mask.

column.name: M2_MASKFRAC
column.description: The PSF weighted mean of the detector coverage of a detection as derived from the detection mask.

column.name: DIST_NN
column.description: The distance to the nearest detection.

column.name: SUM_FLAG
column.description: The summary flag of the source is derived from EP_FLAG. It is 0 if none of the nine flags was set; it is set to 1 if at least one of the warning flags (flag 1, 2, 3, 9) was set but no possible-spurious-detection flag (flag 7, 8); it is set to 2 if at least one of the possible-spurious-detection flags (flag 7, 8) was set but not the manual flag (flag 11); it is set to 3 if the manual flag (flag 11) was set but no possible-spurious-detection flags (flag 7, 8); it is set to 4 if the manual flag (flag 11) as well as one of the possible-spurious-detection flags (flag 7, 8) is set. The meaning is thus: 0 = good, 1 = source parameters may be affected, 2 = possibly spurious, 3 = located in a area where spurious detection may occur, 4 = located in a area where spurious detection may occur and possibly spurious. .

column.name: EP_FLAG
column.description: EPIC flag string made of the flags 1 - 12 (counted from left to right), where flag 10 is not used: it combines the PN, M1, and M2 flags, that is, a flag is set in EP_FLAG if at least one of the camera-dependent flags is set.

column.name: PN_FLAG
column.description: PN flag string made of the flags 1 - 12 (counted from left to right) for the PN source detection.

column.name: M1_FLAG
column.description: M1 flag string made of the flags 1 - 12 (counted from left to right) for the PN source detection.

column.name: M2_FLAG
column.description: PN flag string made of the flags 1 - 12 (counted from left to right) for the M2 source detection.

column.name: TSERIES
column.description: The flag is set to True if this source has a time series made in at least one exposure.

column.name: SPECTRA
column.description: The flag is set to True if this source has a spectrum made in at least one exposure.

column.name: EP_CHI2PROB
column.description: The Chi&sup2; probability (based on the null hypothesis) that the source as detected by any of the cameras, is constant. The minimum value of the available camera probabilities (PN_CHI2PROB, M1_CHI2PROB, M2_CHI2PROB) is given.

column.name: PN_CHI2PROB
column.description: The Chi&sup2; probability (based on the null hypothesis) that the source as detected by the PN camera is constant.

column.name: M1_CHI2PROB
column.description: The Chi&sup2; probability (based on the null hypothesis) that the source as detected by the M1 camera is constant.

column.name: M2_CHI2PROB
column.description: The Chi&sup2; probability (based on the null hypothesis) that the source as detected by the M2 camera is constant.

column.name: VAR_FLAG
column.description: The flag is set to True if this source was detected as variable (Chi&sup2; probability < 1E-5, see PN_CHI2PROB, M1_CHI2PROB, M2_CHI2PROB) in at least one exposure.

column.name: VAR_EXP_ID
column.description: If the source is detected as variable (that is, if VAR_FLAG is set to True), the exposure ID ('S' or 'U' followed by a three-digit number) of the exposure with the smallest Chi&sup2; probability is given here.

column.name: VAR_INST_ID
column.description: If the source is detected as variable (that is, if VAR_FLAG is set to True), the instrument ID (PN, M1, M2) of the exposure given in VAR_EXP_ID is listed here.

column.name: SC_RA
column.description: The mean Right Ascension in degrees (J2000) of all the detections of the source SRCID (see RA) weighted by the positional errors POSERR.

column.name: SC_DEC
column.description: The mean Declination in degrees (J2000) of all the detections of the source SRCID (see DEC) weighted by the positional errors POSERR.

column.name: SC_POSERR
column.description: The error of the weighted mean position given in SC_RA and SC_DEC in arcseconds.

column.name: SC_EP_1_FLUX
column.description: The mean band 1 flux (0.2 - 0.5 keV) of all the detections of the source SRCID (see EP_1_FLUX) weighted by the errors (EP_1_FLUX_ERR), in erg/cm2/s.

column.name: SC_EP_1_FLUX_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean band 1 flux in SC_EP_1_FLUX.

column.name: SC_EP_2_FLUX
column.description: The mean band 2 flux (0.5 - 1.0 keV) of all the detections of the source SRCID (see EP_2_FLUX) weighted by the errors (EP_2_FLUX_ERR), in erg/cm2/s.

column.name: SC_EP_2_FLUX_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean band 2 flux in SC_EP_2_FLUX.

column.name: SC_EP_3_FLUX
column.description: The mean band 3 flux (1.0 - 2.0 keV) of all the detections of the source SRCID (see EP_3_FLUX) weighted by the errors (EP_3_FLUX_ERR), in erg/cm2/s.

column.name: SC_EP_3_FLUX_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean band 3 flux in SC_EP_3_FLUX.

column.name: SC_EP_4_FLUX
column.description: The mean band 4 flux (2.0 - 4.5 keV) of all the detections of the source SRCID (see EP_4_FLUX) weighted by the errors (EP_4_FLUX_ERR), in erg/cm2/s.

column.name: SC_EP_4_FLUX_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean band 4 flux in SC_EP_4_FLUX.

column.name: SC_EP_5_FLUX
column.description: The mean band 5 flux (4.5 - 12 keV) of all the detections of the source SRCID (see EP_5_FLUX) weighted by the errors (EP_5_FLUX_ERR), in erg/cm2/s.

column.name: SC_EP_5_FLUX_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean band 5 flux in SC_EP_5_FLUX.

column.name: SC_EP_8_FLUX
column.description: The mean total band flux (0.2 - 12 keV) of all the detections of the source SRCID (see EP_8_FLUX) weighted by the errors (EP_8_FLUX_ERR), in erg/cm2/s.

column.name: SC_EP_8_FLUX_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean total band flux in SC_EP_8_FLUX.

column.name: SC_EP_9_FLUX
column.description: The mean band 9 flux (0.5 - 4.5 keV) of all the detections of the source SRCID (see EP_9_FLUX) weighted by the errors (EP_9_FLUX_ERR), in erg/cm2/s.

column.name: SC_EP_9_FLUX_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean band 9 flux in SC_EP_9_FLUX.

column.name: SC_HR1
column.description: The mean hardness ratio of the bands 1 and 2 of all the detections of the source SRCID (EP_HR1) weighted by the errors(EP_HR1_ERR).

column.name: SC_HR1_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean hardness ratio in SC_HR1.

column.name: SC_HR2
column.description: The mean hardness ratio of the bands 2 and 3 of all the detections of the source SRCID (EP_HR2) weighted by the errors(EP_HR2_ERR).

column.name: SC_HR2_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean hardness ratio in SC_HR2.

column.name: SC_HR3
column.description: The mean hardness ratio of the bands 3 and 4 of all the detections of the source SRCID (EP_HR3) weighted by the errors(EP_HR3_ERR).

column.name: SC_HR3_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean hardness ratio in SC_HR3.

column.name: SC_HR4
column.description: The mean hardness ratio of the bands 4 and 5 of all the detections of the source SRCID (EP_HR4) weighted by the errors(EP_HR4_ERR).

column.name: SC_HR4_ERR
column.description: Error on the weighted mean hardness ratio in SC_HR4.

column.name: SC_DET_ML
column.description: The total band detection likelihood of the source SRCID is the maximum of the likelihoods of all detections of this source (EP_8_DET_ML).

column.name: SC_EXT_ML
column.description: The total band detection likelihood of the extended source SRCID is the average of the extent likelihoods of all detections of this source (EP_EXTENT_ML).

column.name: SC_CHI2PROB
column.description: The Chi&sup2; probability (based on the null hypothesis) that the unique source SRCID as detected by any of the observations is constant, that is, the minimum value of the EPIC probabilities in each detection, EP_CHI2PROB, is given.

column.name: SC_VAR_FLAG
column.description: The variability flag for the unique source SRCID is set to VAR_FLAG of the most variable detection of this source.

column.name: SC_SUM_FLAG
column.description: The summary flag for the unique source SRCID is taken to be the worst flag of all detections of this source (SUM_FLAG).

column.name: N_DETECTIONS
column.description: The number of detections of the unique source SRCID used to derive the averaged values.
